title: The Great Commission
subtitle: When Jesus transforms followers into sent ones

key_verse.text: And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth. Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you always, even unto the end of the world. Amen.

cards.title: The Mountain of Authority
cards.subtitle: Why the meeting place is significant
cards.content:
Jesus summons the eleven disciples to a mountain in Galilee (Matthew 28:16). This was not accidental. Mountains in Jesus' ministry were always places of revelation:

üèîÔ∏è SIGNIFICANT MOUNTAINS IN MATTHEW:

‚Ä¢ Mount of Beatitudes - Where Jesus taught the Sermon on the Mount (Matthew 5-7)
‚Ä¢ Mount of Transfiguration - Where He was glorified before Peter, James and John (Matthew 17)
‚Ä¢ Mount of Olives - Where He prophesied about the end times (Matthew 24)
‚Ä¢ Mount Calvary - Where He was crucified
‚Ä¢ THIS mountain in Galilee - Where He commissions His disciples

üîç THE CONTRAST:

Galilee was despised by Jerusalem's religious elite. It was considered provincial, the land of the Gentiles. But Jesus CHOOSES Galilee:

‚Ä¢ There He began His ministry (Matthew 4:12-17)
‚Ä¢ There He called His first disciples (Matthew 4:18-22)
‚Ä¢ From there He now sends them to the world

From the despised place, God launches the movement that will change the world.

‚ú® THE ANGEL'S PROMISE:

In Matthew 28:7, the angel had told them: 'Go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him'.

The risen Jesus did NOT stay in Jerusalem (the religious center). He returned to Galilee (where it all began) to close one circle and open a new one.
cards.revelation_key: God doesn't need centers of religious power. From ordinary and despised places, He launches extraordinary movements.

cards.title: Pasa Exousia: Total Authority
cards.subtitle: The declaration that changes everything
cards.content:
Jesus begins with a stunning declaration: 'All power (exousia) is given unto me in heaven and in earth'.

üîë THE GREEK WORD EXOUSIA:

‚Ä¢ Not just 'power' (dynamis = physical power)
‚Ä¢ It's AUTHORITY - the legitimate right to rule
‚Ä¢ It's total jurisdiction, absolute sovereignty
‚Ä¢ It includes both the power AND the right to exercise it

üìä 'ALL POWER' (Pasa Exousia):

Pasa = ALL, every, completely
‚Ä¢ Not '90%' of authority
‚Ä¢ Not 'much' authority
‚Ä¢ ALL authority - no exceptions, no limitations

üåç 'IN HEAVEN AND IN EARTH':

‚Ä¢ Heaven = the spiritual realm, angelic hosts, principalities
‚Ä¢ Earth = the physical realm, governments, nations, humanity

There is no sphere where Jesus does NOT have total authority.

‚è∞ 'IS GIVEN' (perfect passive tense in Greek):

‚Ä¢ Edothƒì - 'has been given and remains given'
‚Ä¢ It's not temporary; it's permanent
‚Ä¢ He didn't earn it; it was GRANTED by the Father

‚úùÔ∏è CONNECTION TO PHILIPPIANS 2:9-11:

'Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow... And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord'.

The Great Commission flows from the GREAT EXALTATION. Jesus doesn't send us from weakness; He sends us from the throne.

greek_words.revelation: Jesus doesn't have 'influence' or 'limited power'. He has TOTAL AUTHORITY. When He sends us, He sends us with the backing of the King of kings.

greek_words.meaning: All, every, the full extent of
greek_words.revelation: There is no area of life where Jesus doesn't have authority. Politics, economics, family, culture - ALL is under His lordship.

cards.revelation_key: The command to make disciples is not a suggestion from an itinerant teacher. It's an order from the King who possesses ALL authority in heaven and earth.

cards.title: Panta Ta Ethnƒì: All Nations
cards.subtitle: The explosion of Jewish particularism
cards.content:
Jesus commands: 'Go ye therefore, and teach ALL NATIONS'.

üí• THE REVOLUTION:

For 2,000 years, since Abraham, the promise had been:
‚Ä¢ 'In thee shall all families of the earth be blessed' (Genesis 12:3)
‚Ä¢ But Israel interpreted this as 'the nations will come to us'
‚Ä¢ Jesus reverses it: 'YOU will go to the nations'

üåé PANTA TA ETHNƒí (All nations):

‚Ä¢ Ethnƒì = ethnic groups, peoples, Gentiles
‚Ä¢ Panta = ALL, without exception
‚Ä¢ Not just 'some nearby nations'
‚Ä¢ Not just 'nations that receive us well'
‚Ä¢ ALL - including enemies, persecutors, those who hate us

üìñ FULFILLMENT OF PROPHECY:

‚Ä¢ Isaiah 49:6 - 'I will also give thee for a light to the Gentiles, that thou mayest be my salvation unto the end of the earth'
‚Ä¢ Psalm 22:27 - 'All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD'
‚Ä¢ Habakkuk 2:14 - 'The earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea'

üë• MAKE DISCIPLES (not just converts):

The key word is MATHƒíTEU≈å (ŒºŒ±Œ∏Œ∑œÑŒµœçœâ):
‚Ä¢ Not 'make sympathizers'
‚Ä¢ Not 'make hearers'
‚Ä¢ MAKE DISCIPLES - learners, committed followers, imitators

üîÑ THE TRIPLE PROCESS:

1Ô∏è‚É£ GO (poreu≈ç) - movement, leaving, going toward
2Ô∏è‚É£ BAPTIZING THEM - public identification with Christ (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
3Ô∏è‚É£ TEACHING THEM - continuous instruction in all that Jesus commanded

It's not an event; it's a PROCESS of formation.

scripture_connections.text: After this I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues
Ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth

cards.revelation_key: The gospel is not for 'people like us'. It's for ALL nations, tribes, tongues and peoples. The church is as diverse as humanity itself.

cards.title: Lo, I Am With You Always
cards.subtitle: The promise that sustains the mission
cards.content:
Jesus ends the Great Commission with the GREAT PROMISE: 'Lo, I am with you always, even unto the end of the world'.

‚ú® 'LO' (Idou):

‚Ä¢ It's a call to attention: 'Look! Pay attention!'
‚Ä¢ It's not casual information; it's solemn PROCLAMATION
‚Ä¢ It's as if He's saying: 'This is the most important thing I must tell you'

ü§ù 'I AM WITH YOU':

Ego eimi meth hym≈çn (·ºêŒ≥·Ωº Œµ·º∞ŒºŒπ ŒºŒµŒ∏·æΩ ·ΩëŒº·ø∂ŒΩ):
‚Ä¢ 'Ego eimi' = I AM (the same divine name from Exodus 3:14)
‚Ä¢ He doesn't say 'my spirit will be' - He says 'I am'
‚Ä¢ It's personal presence, not just influence

‚è∞ 'ALWAYS' (literally 'all the days'):

Pasas tas hƒìmeras (œÄŒ¨œÉŒ±œÇ œÑ·Ω∞œÇ ·º°ŒºŒ≠œÅŒ±œÇ):
‚Ä¢ Not 'most days'
‚Ä¢ Not 'when everything goes well'
‚Ä¢ ALL the days - the good, the bad, the terrible
‚Ä¢ Days of victory and days of defeat
‚Ä¢ Days of crowds and days of loneliness

üåÖ 'UNTO THE END OF THE WORLD':

He≈çs tƒìs synteleias tou ai≈çnos:
‚Ä¢ Not 'until you get tired'
‚Ä¢ Not 'until it gets too hard'
‚Ä¢ Until the CONSUMMATION of the age
‚Ä¢ Until He returns in glory

üîó CONNECTION TO 'EMMANUEL':

Matthew begins his gospel with 'Emmanuel... God with us' (Matthew 1:23).
Matthew ends his gospel with 'I am with you always'.

THE ENTIRE GOSPEL is framed by God's presence with His people. It began with Emmanuel and ends with the promise of perpetual presence.
cards.identity_statement: You are not sent into the world alone. The One who has ALL authority in heaven and earth goes WITH YOU, every day, until the end. The mission is His, not yours.
cards.revelation_key: The Great Commission without the Great Presence would be an impossible burden. But with Jesus with you, every day, until the end - no mission is too great.

discovery_questions.question: Jesus has ALL authority in heaven and earth. Is there any area of your life where you act as if He doesn't have total authority? Politics? Finances? Relationships?
Jesus didn't say 'wait for the nations to come'; He said 'GO to the nations'. Are you waiting for people to come to you, or are you going to them with the gospel?
The Great Commission is to make DISCIPLES (not just converts). Are you investing in forming disciples, or just accumulating decisions for faith?

prayer.title: Prayer of Commissioning
prayer.content: Jesus, King of kings, I acknowledge that ALL authority in heaven and earth belongs to You. You don't send from weakness but from the throne. Today I accept Your commission: to go, make disciples, baptize, teach. I renounce the comfort of waiting for nations to come to me. I rise to go to them. And I cling to Your promise: You are with me ALL the days - the difficult, the dark, the lonely - until the end of the world. I don't go alone. I go with You. May my life be testimony that Emmanuel - God with us - is real. In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, Amen.
